intro: Sessea vestioides, commonly known as the velvetleaf sessea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, warm climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fallow fields. Sessea vestioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world as a garden plant.
